text: I don't like to throw away anything that
has any flavor in it so today I'm going
to start off a soup by making a stock
out of my rotisserie chicken bones
tortellini soup with fresh spinach is
like five ingredients you're not gonna
believe how easy it is
put your bones in your pot and then
cover with 8 cups of cold water bring it
to a boil and simmer it until it's
really nice and flavorful that can be as
little time as thirty minutes as long as
an hour depends on how much time you
have you just want to make sure that
once it comes to a boil you don't
continue boiling it really aggressively
you turn it down to a simmer otherwise
it'll get you know like kind of cloudy
and not so delicious so just keep an eye
on that you want to skim the fat
especially with these rotisserie
chickens if there's little pieces of
skin left on it's gonna cause a lot of
fat to come to the surface so make sure
that you skim it if you want this to be
a really healthy meal and I know you do
I'm gonna strain this they need eight
cups of broth I'm just gonna remove the
carcass before I pour that stock through
because I find that if you pour the
stock through with the carcass in it
everything splashes up in your face so
carefully strain it this is a fine sieve
there's a little bit more than eight
cups so that you can save it just get
rid of those bones
okay so add this back in alright while
that's coming to a boil you can get the
finishing ingredients ready for your
soup you need a lemon wedges tastes
great with the peas and the spinach
you're gonna squeeze these into the soup
to add a little burst of freshness at
the end and then grate a little bit of
parmesan this is going to go into the
soup too nothing adds flavor more than
parmesan add your tortellini the recipe
calls for a pound this is 20 ounces so
I'm gonna save some of this for later in
the week and then you cook it about two
minutes less than the package calls for
and then you're going to add the
finishing touches which are the peas and
spinach baby spinach just needs to come
back to a boil and then cook for a
minute or two season it you may not need
tons and tons of seasoning if the bones
of your burn were kind of salty this
didn't taste too too salty
add a cup of peas these were frozen
defrosted but only slightly there's
still kind of frozen 3 ounces of baby
spinach not only is spinach really good
for you but you really don't need to do
any prep with baby spinach at this point
you could probably even turn it off the
liquids hot enough because the other
thing you don't want is over cooked
spinach right how fast was that so fast
you blinked and it was done right add a
little cheese little lemon squeeze
freshness brightness richness saltiness
totally ninis the best ten minutes I
ever spent
you
